metadata.title: CVE-2020-27507 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The Kamailio SIP before 5.5.0 server mishandles INVITE requests withduplicated fields and overlength tag, leading to a buffer overflow thatcrashes the server or possibly have unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kamailio - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-autheph-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-berkeley-bin - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-berkeley-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-cnxcc-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-cpl-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-erlang-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-extra-modules - 5.5.4-1

kamailio-sctp-modules - 5.5.4-1
kamailio-secsipid-modules - 5.5.4-1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: kamailio package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.4-1').
